intro: Diplycosia gracilipes, commonly known as the slender leaf diplycosia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies due to its ornamental value and ecological role in its native habitat.
